intro: Richardia muricata subsp. pectidifolia, commonly known as the spiny rock nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive spiny leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are often covered with stiff, backward-pointing hairs, which serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores. The species is part of the Urticaceae family, known for its stinging hairs and ecological importance in its native habitats.
